title: LGBT Pride Month kicks off in NEPA 19 hours ago
content: WILKES-BARRE (WOLF) —   June is LGBT Pride Month across the country.    People celebrated it locally with an art show hosted by Tim Maloney in Scranton Friday and has more events planned throughout the month.    Dozens of people came out to show their support.    Organizers say that the LGBT community has come a long way but there is still progress to be made.    "We had a huge amount of progress with marriage equality. That happened, and after that there's still a couple things in the state, you can still be fired for being LGBT. You're not guaranteed housing, There are still a couple things that still prevents us from living freely and openly and being equal to everyone within the community," Ben Eaton, with the NEPA Rainbow Alliance, said.
